title: ICE in FieldPlacement::count atop 32-bit host with 64-bit target

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
While exploring building a cross-compiler and running the test suite on it, I found the following issue:

Using a `config.toml` with:

```
host = ["x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu", "i686-unknown-linux-gnu"]
target = ["x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu", "i686-unknown-linux-gnu"]
```

and then doing `x.py test` eventually hits this problem:

```
./build/i686-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/bin/rustc --target=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -O /tmp/huge-enum.rs
warning: unused variable: `big`
  --> /tmp/huge-enum.rs:23:9
   |
23 |     let big: Option<[u32; (1<<45)-1]> = None;
   |         ^^^ help: consider using `_big` instead
   |
   = note: #[warn(unused_variables)] on by default

thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `4294967295`,
 right: `35184372088831`', src/librustc_target/abi/mod.rs:716:17
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
```

The reason for this ICE is due to a mistake in `rustc`'s internal API here:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/6d34ec18c7d7e574553f6347ecf08e1e1c45c13d/src/librustc_target/abi/mod.rs#L710-L721

As @nagisa points out on [Zulip](https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/131828-t-compiler/subject/cross.20compilation.2064-bit.20atop.2032-bit/near/152329353), the compiler should not be using `usize` except for its own indices "and other memory-ey things"
